snippet.textDisplay: Who of us can say that we haven’t ranted to a friend about our partner/spouse after we are so angry with them! Who hasn’t said ‘I could kill him/her? Called them terrible names and used expletives? Poor Johnny was emotionally traumatised, very hurt and angry at what the disgusting barn witch had done to him, he needed to rant to a friend in order to get rid of his rage. The next day he apologised for his text and said ‘how can you hurt the one you love’. I wonder how many people out there who have ranted to a friend would do that. I don’t blame him at all, he was distraught and yet apologised for it!

snippet.textDisplay:
It’s not whether or not it’s true. It’s about continuing hope to change public perception. What’s true and what really happened is not important to her.
PS: Want to know how much someone sucks? You’re forbidden from speaking their name without possible repercussions. If someone wanted to be famous, they should want everyone speaking their name. They are aware everyone hates them, and they can’t handle it. Think about that if you ever find yourself wondering if team #justiceforjohnny might be wrong.

Edit: Imagine taking the side of the partner that not only lies to the cops and in court (both of which are very illegal) but also might get banned from an entire continent (Aus), and still thinking she’s the good guy.

snippet.textDisplay:
Idjits only read headlines, and do not have the acuity to differ between 'honest' headlines and clickbaits. They believe everything they read. If You tell them to drink bleach, they'll be likely to do it. -Hence it is actuallly illegal to tell someone to go drink bleach, because they might actually be so stupid, that they would do it, if given the idea.
-You know like those home-educated 'beauty-specialists' that use concrete instead of silicone as bodyfillers...
Dumb has no interest in changing. They are not bright enough to understand why they should change.

snippet.textDisplay: She publicly said she kept a gun by her bed for self defense. Then we have audio from the hotel room where she asks him to cut her with a knife. We have him saying that she begged him to go in the bedroom with her. She could have been setting him up to look like an attacker, so she had to "defend herself." She recorded and narrated the self harm episode instead of calling for help, even when the housekeeper came by. It sounds like she brought the knife too. He stated that she interfered with his detox and deprived him of needed meds. Then there's audio where she says that she now sees that he needs medication and he agrees. She says she makes sure he takes "the good ones" and offers him vitamin water because she cares about him. She's no more qualified to manage his medicine than he is. Why was she messing with it? Why would she be insisting that he drinks vitamin water?
snippet.textOriginal: She publicly said she kept a gun by her bed for self defense. Then we have audio from the hotel room where she asks him to cut her with a knife. We have him saying that she begged him to go in the bedroom with her. She could have been setting him up to look like an attacker, so she had to "defend herself." She recorded and narrated the self harm episode instead of calling for help, even when the housekeeper came by. It sounds like she brought the knife too. He stated that she interfered with his detox and deprived him of needed meds. Then there's audio where she says that she now sees that he needs medication and he agrees. She says she makes sure he takes "the good ones" and offers him vitamin water because she cares about him. She's no more qualified to manage his medicine than he is. Why was she messing with it? Why would she be insisting that he drinks vitamin water?

snippet.textDisplay: Look here. I support JD. Do I think there was toxicity that both of them brought into the relationship, the answer is yes. The one that is more at fault is the person the puts their hands on the other first, meaning AH. I'm sure a good amount of Deep fans probably agree with me that JD isn't an unproblemattic Saint. He has problems and issues to work on like the rest of us; what he hasn't done is put his hands on her. I was emotionally, physically, and sexully abused by an ex. The easiest parts to handle and times to handle where when I was emotionally abused, it was so much easier to deal and handle crude words when compared to being throwin into walls and lockers or having my body violated. To the contrary those words hurt me less than the physical parts I want through. Want to call names and be toxic, fine. Want to put your hands on someone and be physically abusive, I think not. There is a fine line between being a toxic ass and an abusive ass, AH crossed the line by putting her hands on JD, end of story.

To the contrary those words hurt me less than the physical parts I want through. Want to call names and be toxic, fine. Want to put your hands on someone and be physically abusive, I think not. There is a fine line between being a toxic ass and an abusive ass, AH crossed the line by putting her hands on JD, end of story.

snippet.textDisplay: @Rock Candy I do agree with you. Again I do side with JD. I'm just not a fan going "He's an innocent angel and did nothing". We primarily hear the argument in the recording, not what led up to the argument so there is still missing context to it; but over all AH is the bad guy. She was the one that ultimately made the decision to hit or "smack" JD, she crossed the line and became the bad guy immediately. I'm just speculating that JD isn't an angel and had some toxic moments that helped to esclate the situation in the end.

snippet.textDisplay:
People in relationships with toxic, abusive partners are often called abusive themselves for reacting to the abuse. In fact, abusers will provoke their targets of abuse to react in order to portray the victim as the abuser. It's a time honored tradition of abusers. Once the abuser is able to goad the victim enough to get a reaction, the abuser turns it around on the victim to make the victim look like the abuser. Johnny calling Amber names in private text messages after the abuse he suffered doesn't make him the abuser. Frankly, calling a woman a witch, who cut off your finger, routinely provoked fights, broke things, threw his phone off the roof top, punched him, threw things at him, and demeaned him, is not sexist. He was justified in his anger toward this horrible, horrible woman. Frankly, she was even worse than he knew since she had been compiling "evidence" against him the entire relationship and ruining his reputation behind his back. That behavior is completely normal for abusers - it's how they get people to align with them against the victim and get off the hook for their abusive behavior. Male abusers and female abusers alike engage in smear campaigns behind the backs of their victims.

I was watching Stevie J Raw's video with Come Geek Some about the mirror incident. That woman left him to bleed for 12 or more hours while she went off and took a dip in the pool or hung out in the sauna, or even just slept. I can't get past the idea that Amber -- whether she was really the "victim" or actually the perpetrator -- left that man to bleed and go without medical care. Even if she had been abused, she would have reached out to his staff to get him medical attention for his finger. His staff was just outside the door, and yet that woman claimed she took a couple of sleeping pills and went to sleep while Johnny bled from a serious injury to his finger. She also claimed that she woke up at noon the next day and the man with his finger cut off purportedly continued to abuse her. Like how is that even possible with his finger cut off?

She also claimed that she woke up at noon the next day and the man with his finger cut off purportedly continued to abuse her.  Like how is that even possible with his finger cut off?
